definition_of_done: Users can see a visual representation of a Rubik's Cube (defaulting to 3x3x3).
Users can interact with the cube to perform standard rotations of faces.
The cube's state correctly updates after each rotation.
The cube has a matte finish by default.
requirements.description: The system shall provide a fully interactive 3D Rubik's Cube accessible via a web browser.

stories.description: As a user, I want to see a 3D representation of a Rubik's Cube so I can prepare to interact with it.

tasks.description: Set up basic HTML/CSS structure for the cube container.
Implement a 3D rendering library (e.g., Three.js) to display cube faces.
Define cube geometry and material properties for the initial/default cube structure.

definition_of_done: Users can input a cube size (N) between 1 and 100.
The user interface includes a slider, a numerical input field, and a set of commonly used preset buttons/options for size selection.
The displayed Rubik's Cube dynamically updates to the specified N x N x N size.
Basic interaction (rotation) functions correctly on the custom-sized cube.
requirements.description: The system shall allow users to customize the size of the Rubik's Cube.

stories.description: As a user, I want to be able to set the cube size using a slider and direct number input, and also quickly select from common predefined sizes, so that I can easily switch between different cube complexities.

tasks.description: Implement a slider UI component for cube size selection.
Add input validation to ensure the selected size is within the 1 to 100 range.
Develop logic to dynamically generate the 3D cube model based on the user-selected size.
Ensure the cube's internal data structure can represent arbitrary N x N x N dimensions.
Implement a numerical input field for precise cube size entry, linked to the slider.
Implement predefined size buttons/options (e.g., 2x2, 3x3, 4x4, 5x5).

clarifications: What constitutes 'common devices' for testing performance (e.g., specific CPU/GPU ranges, memory)?
Are there specific target metrics for 'responsiveness' (e.g., target FPS for small vs. large cubes)?
What is the definition of 'easy to achieve' in terms of development effort vs. performance gain?
definition_of_done: The Rubik's Cube remains interactive and responsive (e.g., rotations feel smooth) for cube sizes up to 10x10x10 on a standard desktop browser.
Performance optimizations (e.g., culling, instance rendering) are implemented where they offer significant gains without substantial development overhead.
The application does not crash or freeze due to excessive memory or CPU usage for any supported cube size.
requirements.description: The system shall be performant, balancing optimal user experience with reasonable development effort.

stories.description: As a user, I want the cube to feel smooth and responsive during interactions, even for larger sizes, so that the experience is enjoyable.

tasks.description: Evaluate and select a 3D rendering strategy that balances performance and ease of implementation (e.g., Three.js, raw WebGL).
Implement efficient geometry and material management for cubelets to minimize draw calls and memory footprint.
Profile performance for cube sizes 3x3x3, 10x10x10, and 20x20x20 on target devices.
Identify and address major performance bottlenecks if responsiveness is not met for reasonable cube sizes.

clarifications: What types of scramble sequences should be generated (e.g., random moves, specific length, WCA notation compliance)?
Should the scrambling process be animated, or instantly applied?
definition_of_done: A 'Scramble' button is visible and interactive.
Clicking 'Scramble' shuffles the cube into a solvable, non-solved state.
The scrambled state is unpredictable and appears random to the user.
requirements.description: The system shall provide a mechanism to scramble the Rubik's Cube.

stories.description: As a user, I want to be able to scramble the cube with a simple action, so I can start a new puzzle challenge.

tasks.description: Design and implement a 'Scramble' button UI element.
Develop a scramble generation algorithm that produces a valid and random cube state.
Apply the generated scramble to the 3D cube model and its internal state.

clarifications: What precision is required for the timer (e.g., seconds, milliseconds)?
Should solve times be stored (e.g., in local storage, for a history/leaderboard)?
What triggers the timer to start and stop precisely (e.g., first move after scramble, last move to solve)?
definition_of_done: A visible timer is displayed on the screen.
The timer automatically starts when the user makes the first move on a scrambled cube.
The timer automatically stops when the cube reaches a solved state.
The final solve time is displayed accurately upon completion.
requirements.description: The system shall track and display the user's solve time for the Rubik's Cube.

stories.description: As a user, I want my solve time to be measured and displayed, so I can challenge myself and track my solving speed.

tasks.description: Implement a real-time stopwatch mechanism in JavaScript.
Develop logic to detect the first user interaction after a scramble to start the timer.
Implement cube state checking to identify when the cube is solved and stop the timer.
Display the elapsed time prominently on the user interface.

clarifications: Can the auto-solving process be paused or stopped by the user once initiated?
Does the solver need to work for all custom cube sizes (1x1 to 100x100) or only standard sizes (e.g., 3x3)?
definition_of_done: A 'Solve' button is available on the UI.
Users can select from 'Beginner-friendly', 'CFOP', and 'Fastest Solves' algorithms for auto-solving (for applicable cube sizes).
Upon activation, the cube animates through the necessary moves generated by the selected algorithm to reach a solved state.
The cube successfully reaches a solved state after the animation sequence.
The animation clearly shows each individual move in the solving algorithm.
Users can adjust the animation speed of the automatic solve.
requirements.description: The system shall provide an automatic solving feature with animated moves and selectable algorithms.

stories.description: As a user, I want to be able to watch the cube solve itself with animated movements, so I can learn the solution steps or simply see the cube solved.

tasks.description: Integrate a Rubik's Cube solving algorithm that generates a sequence of moves for a given state.
Develop an animation engine to visually represent each move of the solving sequence.
Implement a 'Solve' button to trigger the automatic solving process.

stories.description: As a user, I want to choose from 'Beginner-friendly', 'CFOP', and 'Fastest Solves' algorithms for the automatic solver, so I can see different solving approaches in action.

tasks.description: Implement UI elements (e.g., dropdown, radio buttons) to select the desired solving algorithm.
Integrate or implement a beginner-friendly solving algorithm (e.g., Layer-by-Layer).
Integrate or implement a CFOP (Cross, F2L, OLL, PLL) based solving algorithm.
Integrate or implement a 'fastest solves' algorithm (e.g., Kociemba or similar optimized solver, prioritizing minimum move count).
Ensure the selected algorithm is correctly applied when the 'Solve' button is pressed.

stories.description: As a user, I want to adjust the animation speed of the automatic solver, so I can follow the moves at my preferred pace.

tasks.description: Implement a UI control (e.g., slider) for adjusting animation speed.
Integrate the animation speed control with the cube's rotation and transition logic.

clarifications: What level of hints should be provided (e.g., single next move, entire step in an algorithm, visual highlight)?
How are hints triggered (e.g., dedicated 'Hint' button, automatically when stuck for a period)?
Should hints be based on the currently selected auto-solving algorithm, or always use a specific 'beginner-friendly' approach?
Does the hint system need to work for all custom cube sizes (1x1 to 100x100) or only standard sizes (e.g., 3x3)?
definition_of_done: A 'Hint' button or equivalent mechanism is available.
Upon requesting a hint, the system displays the next recommended move to progress towards a solved state, based on the selected solving algorithm.
The hint provided is accurate for the current cube configuration.
requirements.description: The system shall provide hints to assist the user in solving the cube, based on chosen algorithms.

stories.description: As a user, I want to receive hints when I am stuck, so I can learn the solving process and complete the puzzle.

tasks.description: Implement a 'Hint' button on the user interface.
Develop or integrate logic to determine the next optimal move from the current cube state.
Design and implement a way to visually or textually display the hint to the user.
Ensure hints are generated based on the currently selected solving algorithm (beginner, CFOP, fastest).

definition_of_done: Users can rotate the entire cube around its X, Y, and Z axes using clickable arrows.
Users can rotate the entire cube around its X, Y, and Z axes using defined hotkeys (WASD and Q/E).
Rotations occur in distinct 90-degree steps.
The 3D rotations are smoothly animated.
The cube maintains its integrity and state during and after rotation.
requirements.description: The system shall allow users to rotate the entire Rubik's Cube in 3D space.

stories.description: As a user, I want to be able to turn the entire cube in 3D space around all axes using clickable arrows and hotkeys, so I can view it from different perspectives.

tasks.description: Implement camera or cube rotation logic for X, Y, Z axes.
Ensure rotations snap to 90-degree increments.
Design and implement clickable arrow UI elements for 3D rotation (e.g., around the cube's bounding box or on a control panel).
Implement keyboard hotkeys for 3D rotation (W/S for X-axis, A/D for Y-axis, Q/E for Z-axis).
Ensure 3D rotation movements are smoothly animated.

definition_of_done: A user interface option is available to change cube face colors.
Users can select new colors for each of the six faces using a color picker.
Users can select from predefined color palettes, including accessibility options for color blindness.
The chosen colors are applied correctly to the cube faces.
The color changes persist for the current session.
requirements.description: The system shall allow users to customize the colors of the Rubik's Cube faces.

stories.description: As a user, I want to be able to change the colors of the cube faces, so I can customize its appearance and improve accessibility if I am color-blind.

tasks.description: Implement a color selection interface for each cube face.
Develop logic to apply selected colors to the 3D cube model.
Ensure color changes do not affect cube logic (e.g., solving state detection).
Implement a full color picker UI for each of the six cube faces.
Implement a selection of predefined color palettes, including options suitable for common forms of color blindness.

clarifications: Is 'session' defined as a single browser tab, or the entire browser instance (meaning all tabs and windows)?
Should any temporary state, like the current scrambled cube state, persist if the tab is accidentally closed and reopened, or should it always be fresh?
definition_of_done: Closing and reopening the browser tab resets the cube to its default state and clears all user settings/progress.
No user-specific data (e.g., solve times, custom colors, cube size) is stored locally (e.g., Local Storage, IndexedDB) or remotely on persistent storage.
requirements.description: The application shall not persist any user progress or settings between browser sessions.

stories.description: As a developer, I want to ensure the application starts fresh with default settings on each launch, so that there's no need for data persistence mechanisms.

tasks.description: Verify that no data is written to localStorage, sessionStorage, cookies, or IndexedDB.
Implement initialization logic to set default cube state and settings on application load.

clarifications: What specific types of user actions should be undoable/redoable (e.g., individual face turns, full 3D cube rotations, scramble button presses, auto-solve initiation)?
How many steps of history should be maintained (e.g., last 10 moves, unlimited)?
Should undo/redo affect the timer in FR004?
definition_of_done: A visible 'Undo' button is available and active when previous moves exist.
A visible 'Redo' button is available and active when undone moves exist.
Clicking 'Undo' reverts the cube to its previous state.
Clicking 'Redo' reapplies the last undone move.
The cube's state accurately reflects the undo/redo operation.
requirements.description: The system shall provide 'undo' and 'redo' functionality for user actions.

stories.description: As a user, I want to undo my last action so I can correct a mistake or explore alternative moves.

tasks.description: Implement a history stack to record cube states or transformations.
Develop logic to reverse the last cube operation (e.g., face rotation, 3D view rotation).
Design and implement an 'Undo' button UI element.

stories.description: As a user, I want to redo an action that I previously undid, so I can easily revert my decision.

tasks.description: Implement logic to reapply a move from the redo stack.
Design and implement a 'Redo' button UI element.

clarifications: What specific actions should trigger sound effects (e.g., individual face rotations, cube scrambled, cube solved, hint activated, undo/redo)?
Should the sound effects be realistic (e.g., plastic clicking) or more stylized?
definition_of_done: Classic Rubik's Cube sound effects play correctly for cube rotations, scramble, and solve events.
Sound effects always play at full volume (no mute or volume controls needed).
Sound levels are balanced and non-intrusive.
requirements.description: The system shall incorporate classic Rubik's Cube sound effects for key user interactions and cube events.

stories.description: As a user, I want to hear distinct classic Rubik's Cube sound effects when I interact with the cube or when significant events occur, so the application feels more immersive and responsive.

tasks.description: Source or create classic sound assets for cube face rotations.
Source or create a classic sound asset for the cube scrambling action.
Source or create a classic sound asset for successfully solving the cube.
Implement audio playback functionality to trigger sounds on relevant events at full volume.
